title: Ticket #3752: Change in _CONDOR_SLOT values?
description:
We got a ticket from a client who noticed a change in behavior for _CONDOR_SLOT after upgrading to 7.8.8. I took a look through the source and couldn't find anything obvious, so I'm pitching it over the wall to you guys:

Client report: We had some jobs failing after upgrading to 7.8.8 because of the way the _CONDOR_SLOT sends back the variable. In 7.6.x it sends back a number (1, 2, etc..). In 7.8.8 it sends back a string (slot1, slot2, etc..). Is this a bug in 7.8.8? The manual for 7.8 says that it should be sending back a number.
remarks:
2013-Jul-11 14:20:20 by bcotton:
One additional change in behavior to note. In 7.8.8, a job running on a single-slot machine will have _CONDOR_SLOT empty, whereas in 7.6 it was still '1'.
